results.title: Allegro molto from the symphony No.5 in E flat by Jean Sibelius
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Music in Motion”.
Scenes of the granitic hardness and glacial sparkle of Finland describe part of the Fifth Symphony of Sibelius. Snow-capped mountains and trees reflected in deep blue lakes, falling snow in a dense evergreen forest, sunny snow-banks of a glacier reflect the composer’s changing moods from strong unrelenting harmonies to soft tremolos and pizzicato passages. (A study guide is available with this film). From the “Music in motion” series.

results.title: Moussorgsky: 'Pictures at an exhibition'
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Music in Motion”.
Scenes of the flower gardens at Paris’ Louvre and Tuileries Park, children playing, fluffy chicks running about, the bustling market place at Limoges and the Paris Catacombs are shown to express part of Moussorgsky’s composition “Pictures at an Exhibition”. The composer wrote the music to pay homage to paintings by his friend Victor Hartmann.

results.title: Vaughan Williams: a London symphony - Scherzo (Nocturne) (3rd Movement)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Music in Motion”
The sights, sounds and feelings of London at night aptly illustrate the third movement of Vaughan Williams’ London Symphony. The fountain at Marble Arch, pigeons in Trafalgar Square, moving traffic, flickering neon signs, a Cockney blowing on a mouth-organ, are contrasted with the dignity and tradition of the House of Parliament, and the evening mist and sunset along the Thames Embankment. Includes a Study Guide.

results.title: Beef background
results.brief_description: Describes the production of fine cattle and quality beef in Australia for domestic and overseas markets. Includes the angus, devon, hereford and santa catrudez breeds. Narrated by Barry Brady.

results.title: Because it's just me
results.creator_credit: Richard Even, Jan E Skrentry and WNVT Northern Virginia
results.brief_description: Encourages students to examine their own talents., abilities, likes and dislikes and visualise how these might influence their future career choices, opportunities and leisure activities. Suitable for Mid-Upper Secondary level students.

results.title: Beautiful people [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Jasmin Disdar, Ben Woolford and Beautiful stories
results.brief_description: The ethnic conflict in the former Yugoslavia is an unlikely subject matter for this British black comedy which uses the Balkan war as a catalyst to explore a contemporary London bursting with racial discord. The films interconnected stories are set off by a brawl between a Serbian (Dado Jehan) and a Croatian (Faruk Pruti) on a busy downtown London bus, an apt and humorous metaphor for the worsening situation. Meanwhile a headmaster’s football hooligan son, inadvertently lands right in the middle of the war, a Tory MP’s daughter (Charlotte Coleman) falls in love with one of her patients and a BBC war correspondent suffering from ‘Bosnia syndrome’ tries to amputate his leg. Cast also includes Charles Kay, Julian Firth, Edward Jewsebury, Edin Dzandzanovic, Gilbert Martin. (Award: 1999 Winner-Un Certain Regard, Jasmin Disdar)

results.title: Beating the bracken
results.creator_credit: New South Wales. Dept. of Agriculture
results.brief_description: Recommends methods of removing bracken from the rich dairy country in the New South Wales coastal belt. Explains that broken bracken is the first stage in the removal of the pest. Illustrates the use of specially designed three-bladed rollers on hilly country. On level pastures the simple square log roller with steel flanges, the mower, the rotary hoe, or other mechanical equipment are suggested.

results.title: Beara
results.creator_credit: Paddy Carey, Richard Bigham and Rosemead Films
results.brief_description: Shows many aspects of the landscape and bird life of the Beara Peninsula region in the Cork-Kerry area of the south west of Ireland. No spoken commentary.
